section.title: Quick-start checklist
section.para: Complete the following tasks to set up your company environment.
section.bridgehead: 1. Evaluate the security needs of your users
section.para: Security policies are always applied to groups, and all group members inherit the policy settings. Your Symantec Security Cloud account comes with a default security policy that is applied to the default group. This policy may be all you need to meet your security requirements.
See How protection features works in Symantec Security Cloud
If some of your users have different security needs, you can create additional policies and groups, as described in the next task.
section.bridgehead: 2. Add policies and groups as needed
section.para: Do all users have the same security needs?

listitem.para: Create additional groups and apply the policies to them.
See How groups manage policy flow in Symantec Security Cloud

section.bridgehead: 3. Create an email access policy as needed
section.para: Do you want your users to access company email on their devices?

listitem.para: See Managing access to company email
Apply the policy to all applicable groups.

section.bridgehead: 4. Configure support for Apple device management
section.para: To manage OS X or iOS devices, Apple requires you to create an APNs certificate.

note.para: Be sure to configure support for Apple devices before you add users.

section.para: When you create user accounts for your employees, they can enroll their own devices in Symantec Security Cloud. You can create users manually, or you can import users from the Microsoft Azure Active Directory cloud service.

itemizedlist.title: If you plan to integrate with Azure Active Directory, you have to use the following workarounds, which apply to the initial Beta release only:

listitem.para: Do not create any end-user accounts before you integrate, or those users will not be able to authenticate successfully.
Do create additional administrator accounts manually, before you integrate. You can't change their role to administrator after the first sync.
After integration, you and all other administrators must bookmark the following URL and use it to sign in:

ulink.url: If you plan to integrate with Azure Active Directory, be sure to set up that integration before you create users. Once you integrate with Active Directory, all synched users are authenticated against Active Directory. All users who already existed, however, will not be able to log in. This includes the initial company administrator. To work around this issue, bookmark this page and use it to sign in: https://securitycloud.symantec.com/sso/login?admin=1. This issue will be addressed in the next beta.

section.para: Do you want to sync users from your directory service?

listitem.para: Create administrator accounts manually, before you sync.
Set up the Azure AD Sync service.
See Connecting with Azure Active Directory Sync
All imported users are added to the default group and assigned the User role.
If you created multiple groups, move users to other groups as needed.

section.para: After user accounts are created, users receive an email that invites them to set their password and enroll their devices. As an administrator, you can enroll your own devices, devices that you prepare for other users, and servers. The only way to enroll Windows servers is with a server installation package.

note.para: Servers are not supported in the initial Beta release.

entry.para: Sign in to Symantec Security Cloud from the device you want to enroll, and follow the on-screen instructions.
See Deploying a Windows installation package

section.para: As devices complete the enrollment process, data starts to appear on the dashboard. You can go to the dashboard now and start monitoring your environment.
